frontMatter.title: Form step - Minimal
frontMatter.description: A simplified form step template with reduced header/footer to minimize cognitive load.
frontMatter.intro: This template is for all internal pages of a digitized form that asks Veterans to enter information, select an option, or upload supporting documents. It uses a simplified header/footer to reduce cognitive load.

when_to_use.value: **All new forms.** All new forms should use this template per current guidance.
**Multi-page form flows.** Creating multi-page form flows (excluding introduction, review, confirmation pages).
**Authenticated or unauthenticated.** Forms requiring either authenticated or unauthenticated user experiences.

when_not_to_use.value: **Introduction pages.** Use the Introduction template instead.
**Review pages.** Use the Review template instead.
**Confirmation pages.** Use the Confirmation template instead.
**Existing forms.** Unless migration investment is justified.

usability.value: **Request prerequisite information.** Gather information before it's needed in the flow.
**Front-load easier questions.** Start with easier questions for user comfort.
**Group related information.** Organize logically by topic.

structure.intro: The template has authenticated and unauthenticated variations with minimal chrome.

content_guidelines.value: **Unique H1 per page.** Each question page requires a unique H1 that describes the requested information.
**H1 can be input label.** The H1 can be a text input label, form field group legend, or standalone text coded as H1.
**Fieldset/legend structure.** Associate helper text with the legend for proper screen reader announcement.
**Keep hint text brief.** Single short sentences; avoid line breaks and links.

accessibility.value: **Unique H1 prevents disorientation.** Repetitive H1s confuse sighted and screen reader users.
**Proper fieldset/legend associations.** Essential for screen reader users.
**Focus management.** Consistent navigation for keyboard users.
Research found sighted users confused by repetitive H1s and step headings.
Screen reader users reported disorientation from redundant H1s.
Mobile magnification users may have content hidden below fold.
